column4: Anybody that can spare 5min to try and help me with my wireless network?
what do you have, elaborate on your setup, and what you have done so far to test?
do you see the dialog window or should I write it out here?
I do not see it,  write it out here, but limit to 3 lines,
Any idea on what I should try next?
lspci  and look in the list if your wifi card is detected
08:0a.0 Networkcontroller: Broadcom Corporation BCM4318 [AirForce One 54g] 802.11g Wireless LAN controller (rev 02). Does that mean its on? Or just detected?
it meant it is detected
Is there some way to see if its on?
if you see it in lspci, it is ON
really? then im lost. I have no idea what do to next. Arent there some sort of wireless manager that is able to scan for connection instead of me writing a specific one?
the thing is you are one of those lucky many to be using the dreaded broadcom chip 43xxx.
Which means im screwed? Or is there a way?
you can use restrictred drivers for it or maybe ndiswrapper, basically the issue is the driver for bcm43xx chips
you may have to google for it...let see if the bot has any
Ok. I installed the ndiswrapper for my card but I dont know were to manage ndiswrapper
Should I (and how) uninstall ndiswrapper and WiFi radar before using the guide you linked me?
follow that guide,  yeah may as well remove ndiswrapper and follow that link suggestions
You have been very helpful. Thank you :) But I have a minor question. I have to activate some drivers that arent in use and I see ATI accelerated Graphics driver on the list. Should I activate?
i dont know if you must activate those ATI, those are for video not for your wifi
so if it was me, I would not activate ATI lest I have to use them
Okok. Ill worry about that later on :)
I tried that guide. I cant remove the ndiswrapper and when I scan for networks I get "No scan results"
